comment.author: 84195101@N00
comment._content: I'm suspicious that this photo was 'faked' for the press by the developers of the Empire State Building, in the same way that this one was: www.metmuseum.org/exhibitions/view?exhibitionId=%7B36D817... (from the Met Museum in New York). The two other airships in the sky makes me suspicious, as well as the near-perfect composition. Whilst there were apparently a few 'trial' dockings of airships with the Empire State Building whilst it was under construction, I doubt that there were such high quality photographs taken of those moments!

comment.author: 79953757@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/frankieroberto] The Zeppelin is far beyond the tower.  The photographer was fortunate that from his vantage point it came into position to suggest it might be moored there.  I would guess that if the ship was at the same distance from the camera as the building it would be a good deal larger.
